ygData.subject: Re: [rest-discuss] Sun proposes to apply Web service standardization principles to REST
ygData.msgSnippet: ... yeah, I m not speaking in favour of SOA, just that REST could be a little more concrete. OK not REST, but I d like some more concrete to point at and

On 15 Feb 2007, at 00:08, Bill de hOra wrote:
> > What worries me most about REST is that it isn't testable.
>
> But it is explicit. It's difficult to say that about SOA.

yeah, I'm not speaking in favour of SOA, just that REST
could be a little more concrete. OK not REST, but I'd
like some more concrete to point at and advise people
to emulate.


> Then again is this really a useful way to speak - I could
> say "what worries me about
> design patterns is that they aren't testable"
> - but what would that mean?


That's fair comment, but if you use a framework (Hmm. is it a
framework, dunno) such as JSR 311, then chances
are you're going to expose your service RESTfully, and
that can only be goodness.

--
http://blog.whatfettle.com
